intro: Bertya calycina, commonly known as the mountain hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Mexico and Central America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink and red. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often hairy, providing a distinctive appearance. Bertya calycina thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in humid, shaded environments.
